rComments: Wonderful prof. This man knows his stuff and even though his lectures are a bit dry, he's capable of conveying a good lecture. Super lecture heavy but that's Syntax for you. 3 quizzes, 1 midterm, 1 final. Didn't answer questions in class but to be fair there was too much material to get through. Textbook was so helpful, study it to do well.
Genuinely the best professor I have had to date, he was extremely clear on all guidelines and in explanation. He answers questions well and gets to the point. Very punctual and helpful.
Professor Ott knows his content. Regardless of the class' difficulty, I enjoyed his lectures. He knows what he's talking about.

Dennis was a really nice person and was always willing to answer students' questions during lecture time, but I felt that the course content was so heavy considering many people just came from the introduction course. There is a ton of reading and exercises per week along with the lecture/DGDs that if you don't do all three you'll fall behind fast

Professor Ott is a very structured, knowledgeable and engaging lecturer. He promptly and directly answers students questions allowing for a better and clearer understanding of the subject matter. His lectures closely resemble and elaborate on the assigned readings, so I recommend students complete said readings before attending lectures.

I initially was not a huge fan of the class as I did poorly on the first quiz and did not feel prepared for it. However, once I learned his teaching style I found the course far easier. Be prepared to do a lot of self-learning and independent work, just showing up to the lectures are not enough.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Lecture heavy', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: I was terrified of this class because I barely passed LIN2310 (with a different prof). Ott made syntax so easy and accessible for me. Attendance isn't mandatory but he does such a good job of explaining concepts that it's in your best interest to go. Definitely makes you work for your grade, but gives you all the tools you need to succeed.

Youre probably obligated to take this class. Not as kind and welcoming as Kevin at all. Was marked on 3 quizzes, the midterm and the exam; no assignments. Do your readings and go to class or you will not do well. Although he allows a cheat sheet for the midterm and final, he is a tough grader and not very helpful when it comes to asking questions.

Chances are you're obligated to take this class. Posts all the slides online so you don't have to bother going to class. Grading consists of midterm and exam, and 4 assignments that he takes your top 3 marks from. Not an overly engaging prof, lectures get boring but they do their job.

Way better than Kevin in my opinion. He posts his slides and lets you use cheat sheets for the (1) midterm and the final exam. There are 4 assignments and he takes off the lowest grade. Go to class! My only problem with him is that he could have explained the material in simpler terms. Great prof overall!

Learned a lot in his class, Dr. Ott is very good at explaining the complicated material. Class had 4 assignments, a midterm, and an exam. Go to class and do the readings and you'll be fine. He's pretty formal, but he seems like a genuinely nice person. I had a good experience in his class
DO THE READINGS BEFORE CLASS or you will have no clue what is going on! I did the readings and was still lost! Overall a good course but easy to get lost and fall behind

Good professor who knows his stuff. Uses slides (which are uploaded) but he elaborates greatly on them in class. Midterms and final are very difficult but he allows one page of cheat sheet so you can put lots of info on it. Is not very welcoming, may seem a little cold and rude (sometimes doesn't let students finish questions before answering)
Tests/Exams are hard. A very strict grader and not helpful.

Overall I fairly good prof. For the midterm and exam he allowed a cheat sheet that we could use. Is lectures did tend to become  a bit boring and repetitive but he did add funny memes sometimes to make it more interesting. Biggest concern is that when someone asks questions, he won't let them finish and attempts to answer it before they finish.

you probably have no choice but to take him tbh. class content is easy if you keep up but his slides are absolutely garbage no details at all so you must be in class at all times but theres hardly anything to refer to for an exam. isn't as welcoming as Kevin McMullin for sure. Read the textbook. Hope there is marks for attendance.

Best looking genius man who worked under the god of linguistics. Not as good as McMullin in terms of lectures because of how heavy his powerpoints are. Need more  hands on work with students, use the chalkboard and engage the students. Amazing professor over all, he's clearly intelligent!
Tough marker, excellent teacher

He's a very good prof. The only thing is he expects too much from the students. Most of the stuff we learned was theoretical so it was pretty difficult to keep up. He took way too many marks off for little things. He sometimes had attitude when you questioned him. To be honest this class was pretty boring and the DGD's were absolutely useless.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Dennis is a great professor but he also expects a lot from his students. I was surprised when many students failed the midterm he still made the final exam practically impossible. It was his first time teaching as a professor so he has a lot to learn but I think he still did a good job. The one thing I wish he did was practice questions in the DGDs
